page.title: 02Farming around Baker Street
page.content: There are three farms in this area, namely Hoblets Farm, Poplar Farm and Whitefields Farm. They are owned by one family who live outside the area. The fen land in the area was once common land used for grazing but during the war it was ploughed up to produce food as part of the war effort. The intention was that the fen would revert back to common land, but this never happened. Gradually dairy farming was phased out in favour of arable crops. The small council estate in this area was once an orchard. There is still some rough grazing land to be seen around the Baker Street area and Hoblets Farm has a pheasant hatchery.
